title.value: Физиологическое состояние и продуктивность бычков при использовании экструдированного обогатителя в составе комбикорма КР-3
Physiological condition and productivity of calves when using extruded enricher in KR-3 compound feed
Physiological condition and productivity of calves when using extruded enricher in KR-3 compound feed

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Radchikov, V.F., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)
Shinkareva, S.L., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)
Ganushchenko, O.F., Vitebsk State Academy of Veterinary Medicine (Belarus)
Yaroshevich, S.A., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)
Bud'ko, V.M., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)
Shevtsov, A.N., National Academy of Sciences. Scientific and Practical Center of Animal Breeding (Belarus)

abstract.value: Vitebsk Zonal institute of Agriculture of NAS of Belarus together with Osipovichskij Bakery develop new technology of production extruded food concentrate (EFC) on the basis of flax seed and middling. As a result of researches on working off optimum input rates of EFC in structure of compound fodders KR-3 it is established, that feeding by compound feed KR-3 with extruded enricher in the amount of 10% by weight instead of barley in a diet promotes activization of microbiological processes in the rumen, that leads to decrease in quantity of ammonia on 12%, to increase in a level of the general nitrogen at 21%, to increase in digestibility of dry, organic substances, protein, fat and cellular tissue - on 3,0-6,3%, to improvement of nitrogen use on 3,3% from accepted. Inclusion EFC in bulls' diets renders positive influence on oxidation-reduction processes in animals organism to what the morphological-biochemical structure of blood testifies. Thus increase of concentration of the general protein in blood whey on 7,5%, decrease in the contents of urea on 14,9% (Р0,05) is observed. Feeding of compound fodder, enriched EFC in quantity of 10% on weight, to young growth of large horned livestock provides increase average daily gain on 7% and decreases in expenses of forages at 1 gain center on 6%, reception of additional profit on 11% is more than control
